clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Endobronchial Ultrasound (EBUS) for Staging Lung Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Endobronchial Ultrasound (EBUS) for Staging Lung Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: This study will compare two different methods of staging lung cancer to determine whether endobronchial ultrasound (EBUS) staging of mediastinal lymph nodes will provide good diagnostic yield in detecting lung cancer, when compared to current methods of a staging bronchoscopy and cervical mediastinoscopy.

primary_outcome.description: Lung cancer staging (assessed by either cervical mediastinoscopy or EBUS) will be compared both pre-op and post-op.

arm_group.description: This group will undergo cervical mediastinoscopy before surgery to stage their lung cancer (procedure decided by the surgeon).
This group will undergo endobronchial ultrasound before surgery to stage their lung cancer (procedure decided by the surgeon).

study_pop.textblock: Patients undergoing a staging procedure for lung cancer (either cervical mediastinoscopy or endobronchial ultrasound).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Patients, > 18 years of age,
Gender- Males and Female
Diagnosis of Non Small Cell Lung Cancer.
Patients who have consented on an Ottawa Hospital consent form to undergo a mediastinoscopy procedure or EBUS-TBNA, and a Positron emission tomography (PET) of the chest for lung cancer staging.
Exclusion Criteria:
Females who are pregnant (or found to be pregnant) during the course of this research study.
Patients who do not provide their Ottawa Hospital consent to undergo a staging bronchoscopy , cervical mediastinoscopy or EBUS-TBNA.
